alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 28 at 4:59AM PDT until May 29 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 5 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM PDT SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM PDT SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 2 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...West-southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45-55 mph. Stronger gusts possible. Visibility between one quarter mile and one mile in blowing dust expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 8 AM PDT Sunday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 5 PM Sunday to 2 AM PDT Monday. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 8 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep your foot off the brake pedal. Remember, pull aside, stay alive. A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
